meanings.sent1: The pretested toy was guaranteed to be safe for children to play with.
meanings.sent2: The pretested software performed flawlessly without any errors.
meanings.sent3: The pretested cake recipe turned out to be a disaster, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her pretested theory on plant growth proved to be accurate after conducting the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The pretested parachute design ensured the skydivers' safety during the jump.

meanings.definition: Subjected to a test before use or implementation
meanings.sent1: The pretested car passed all safety checks with flying colors.
meanings.sent2: The pretested medicine was approved for distribution after rigorous trials.
meanings.sent3: The pretested plan to build a treehouse faced unexpected challenges along the way.
meanings.sent4: His pretested knowledge of the subject helped him excel in the exam.
meanings.sent5: The pretested bridge design prevented any structural failures during heavy storms.
